pages.text: These structural wires do not transmit electricity, but can be used for other purposes, such as for decoration or for traversal using the $(l:tools/skyhook)Engineer's Skyhook$().
These are purely decorate connectors for the structural wires. You can rotate them by right-clicking with the $(hammer).
Similarly, wallmounts can be used to place wire connectors upright or upside-down on walls.

Balloons are sacks of fabric with a heat source in the middle to keep them afloat. They can be placed in mid-air. Both kinds of structural wires can be attached to them. Sneak-clicking while holding will allow you to set a height offset for placement.

You can also uses dyes on a placed balloon; which part you dye depends on where you target it. Right-clicking with an $(hammer) will toggle the balloon's design between horizontal or vertical stripes.
